text.__SUMMARY__: Conus fumigatus, common name the smoky cone, is a species of sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Conidae, the cone snails and their allies.Like all species within the genus Conus, these snails are predatory and venomous. They are capable of "stinging" humans, therefore live ones should be handled carefully or not at all.
text.Description: The size of the shell varies between 30 mm and 69 mm.
text.Distribution: This species occurs in the Red Sea  off Ethiopia; in the Libyan part of the Mediterranean Sea (as an introduced species).
